text:
WinNT 4 SP6
I use jdk 1.3.1

I have installed Tomcat 3.2.1, I have setted the TOMCAT_HOME and JAVA_HOME as 
described in the manual.
After that I have started Tomcat.

The servlet examples are working fine.

But with the jsp examples I got the error:

Error: 500
Location: /examples/jsp/num/numguess.jsp
Internal Servlet Error:

org.apache.jasper.JasperException: Unable to compile error: An error has 
occurred in the compiler; please file a bug report 
(http://java.sun.com/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi).
1 error

	at org.apache.tomcat.facade.JasperLiaison.javac(JspInterceptor.java:708)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.facade.JasperLiaison.processJspFile(JspInterceptor.java:619)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.facade.JspInterceptor.requestMap(JspInterceptor.java:435)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.core.ContextManager.processRequest(ContextManager.java:869)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.core.ContextManager.internalService(ContextManager.java:781)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.core.ContextManager.service(ContextManager.java:739)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.modules.server.Http10Interceptor.processConnection(Http10Inter
ceptor.java:150)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.util.net.TcpWorkerThread.runIt(PoolTcpEndpoint.java:430)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run(ThreadPool.java:50
5)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:484)


In the Tomcat window I see the following stackTrace:

java.lang.IllegalAccessError: try to access method 
sun.tools.java.Identifier.setType(I)V from class sun.tools.java.Scanner
   at sun.tools.java.Scanner.defineKeyword(Scanner.java:180)
   at sun.tools.java.Scanner.<clinit>(Scanner.java:188)
   at sun.tools.javac.BatchEnvironment.parseFile(BatchEnvironment.java:461)
   at sun.tools.javac.Main.compile(Main.java:485)
   at 
org.apache.jasper.compiler.SunJavaCompiler.compile(SunJavaCompiler.java:158)
   at org.apache.tomcat.facade.JasperLiaison.javac(JspInterceptor.java:699)
.
.
.

I got the same error with Tomcat 3.3 Milestone3

#package.access=sun.  in security.java is commented out
creator: jozsef.kiss-beck@sysdata.siemens.hu
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Check your classpath, maybe you have some older java in classpath. Try
reinstalling java, make sure it's installed corectly. Jsp works fine for most 
people ( excluding Jon Stevens, of course ). This seems very likely a config
problem.
